course.title: Germany and the Greeks: Winckelmann to Heidegger
course.description: In reading through major works of literature and philosophical prose, this course critically interrogates the persistent fascination that ancient Greek literature and culture exerted on the modern German imagination from the eighteenth to the twentieth centuries. Areas of discussion include antiquarianism, the formation of national identity, genius and the classical tradition, pedagogy and politics, aesthetics and reception theory. Cross-listed with Comparative Literature.
